required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Intense Exercise on Neural Responses to Food.
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of High Intensity Exercise on Neural Responses to Images of Food

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this study was to determine the effects of an acute bout of high intensity exercise on the brains response to viewing pictures of food using functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI).

detailed_description.textblock: It is clear that intense exercise impacts on peripheral appetite regulation, however very little is known about the impact of high-intensity exercise on central appetite regulation. This study aimed to investigate the effects of high-intensity exercise on both central and peripheral responses to images of food. Functional magnetic resonance techniques were used to assess the brains response to images of high and low calorie foods, following a short bout of high-intensity exercise. Appetite hormone concentrations were also measured. It was hypothesized that, due to the known effects of high-intensity exercise on appetite regulatory hormones and subjective appetite ratings, the activation of reward-related brain regions to visual food cues would be modulated following intense physical activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Neural responses following exercise and rest
primary_outcome.description: Volunteers completed an fMRI assessment following 60 minutes of intense exercise and 60 minutes of rest on two separate occasions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken at baseline, following exercise/rest, prior to the fMRI assessment and immediately following the fMRI assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were taken using a cannula system for both trials. Concentrations of appetite regulating hormones were measured from plasma.

arm_group.description: 60 minutes of high intensity treadmill running

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy, non-smokers, free from cardiovascular disease and metabolic disease, no medication, participated in moderate/vigorous physical activity (>2 hours per week)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smokers, history of cardiovascular/metabolic disease, low physical activity levels, inability to participate in fMRI scanning sessions including contraindications to MRI
